Definition: from {{h6586}}; a revolt (national, moral or religious); rebellion, sin, transgression, trespass.
a primitive root; to dispart (the feet or lips), i.e. become licentious; open (wide).
a primitive root; to tear in pieces; pull in pieces.
probably from {{h6582}}; liberation; Pashchur, the name of four Israelites; Pashur.
probably from an unused root meaning to disintegrate; stupidity (as a result of grossness or of degeneracy); extremity.
a primitive root; to spread; spread.
a primitive root (identical with through the idea of expansion); to break away (from just authority), i.e. trespass, apostatize, quarrel; offend, rebel, revolt, transgress(-ion, -or).
from {{h6585}}; a stride; step.

a primitive root; to spread out (i.e. deploy in hostile array); by analogy, to strip (i.e. unclothe, plunder, flay, etc.); fall upon, flay, invade, make an invasion, pull off, put off, make a road, run upon, rush, set, spoil, spread selves (abroad), strip (off, self).
a primitive root; to stride (from spreading the legs), i.e. rush upon; go.
the same as {{h6510}}; Parah, a place in Palestine; Parah.
feminine of {{h6499}}; a heifer; cow, heifer, kine.
for {{h6288}}; foliage; Purah, an Israelite; Phurah.
from {{h6331}}; a hole (as broken, i.e. dug); + mole. Compare {{h2661}}.
passive participle of {{h6524}}; blossomed; Paruach, an Israelite; Paruah.
or פְּרִידָא; from {{h6504}}; dispersion; Peruda or Perida, one of 'Solomon's servants'; Perida, Peruda.
passive participle of {{h6565}} in the sense of spreading out (compare {{h6524}}); a skillet (as flat or deep); pan, pot.
of foreign origin; Parvajim, an Oriental region; Parvaim.
from the same as {{h6518}}; an open country; (unwalled) town (without walls), unwalled village.
from an unused root meaning to separate, i.e. decide; a chieftain; village.
from {{h6501}}; wildly; Piram, a Canaanite; Piram.
or פַּרְוָר; of foreign origin; Parbar or Parvar, a quarter of Jerusalem; Parbar, suburb.
or פֶּרֶה; (Jeremiah 2:24), from {{h6500}} in the secondary sense of running wild; the onager; wild (ass).
feminine of {{h6505}}; a she-mule; mule.
feminine passive participle of {{h6504}}; something separated, i.e. a kernel; seed.
a primitive root; to break through, i.e. spread or separate (oneself); disperse, divide, be out of joint, part, scatter (abroad), separate (self), sever self, stretch, sunder.
from {{h6504}}; a mule (perhaps from his lonely habits); mule.
of foreign origin; a park; forest, orchard.
a primitive root; to bear fruit (literally or figuratively); bear, bring forth (fruit), (be, cause to be, make) fruitful, grow, increase.
of foreign origin; Paras (i.e. Persia), an Eastern country, including its inhabitants; Persia, Persians.
from {{h6536}}; a claw; also a kind of eagle; claw, ossifrage.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6536}}; to split up; divide, (U-) pharsin.
a primitive root; to break in pieces, i.e. (usually without violence) to split, distribute; deal, divide, have hoofs, part, tear.
of uncertain derivation; Parnak, an Israelite; Parnach.
of Persian origin; Parmashta, a son of Haman; Parmasta.
a primitive root; to tear; rend.
feminine active participle of the same as {{h6531}}; a separatrix, i.e. (the sacred) screen; vail.
from an unused root meaning to break apart; fracture, i.e. severity; cruelty, rigour.
from {{h6555}}; violent, i.e. a tyrant; destroyer, ravenous, robber.
plural of {{h6556}}; breaks; Peratsim, a mountain in Palestine; Perazim.
patronymically from {{h6557}}; a Partsite (collectively) or descendants of Perets; Pharzites.

a primitive root; to break out (in many applications, direct and indirect, literal and figurative); × abroad, (make a) breach, break (away, down, -er, forth, in, up), burst out, come (spread) abroad, compel, disperse, grow, increase, open, press, scatter, urge.
probably from {{h6565}} in the sense of rushing; rapid; Parpar, a river of Syria; Pharpar.
the same as {{h6556}}; Perets, the name of two Israelites; Perez, Pharez.
from {{h6555}}; a break (literally or figuratively); breach, breaking forth (in), × forth, gap.
the same as {{h6550}}; Parosh, the name of our Israelite; Parosh, Pharosh.
probably from {{h6544}} and {{h6211}}; a flea (as the isolated insect); flea.
or פִּרְעָתֹנִי; patrial from {{h6552}}; a Pirathonite or inhabitant of Pirathon; Pirathonite.
from {{h6546}}; chieftaincy; Pirathon, a place in Palestine; Pirathon.
from {{h6527}}; a stray or single berry; grape.
from {{h6509}}; fruit (literally or figuratively); bough, (first-)fruit(-ful), reward.
from the same as {{h6518}}; magistracy, i.e. leadership (also concretely, chieftains); village.
or פְּרוֹזִי; from {{h6519}}; a rustic; village.
for {{h6521}}; inhabitant of the open country; a Perizzite, one of the Canaanitish tribes; Perizzite.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h1270}}; iron; iron.

a primitive root; to break forth as a bud, i.e. bloom; generally, to spread; specifically, to fly (as extending the wings); figuratively, to flourish; × abroad, × abundantly, blossom, break forth (out), bud, flourish, make fly, grow, spread, spring (up).
from {{h6524}}; a calyx (natural or artificial); generally, bloom; blossom, bud, flower.
from {{h6524}}; progeny, i.e. a brood; youth.
a primitive root; to scatter words, i.e. prate (or hum); chant.
of Egyptian derivation; Paroh-Chophra, an Egyptian king; Pharaoh-hophra.
or פַּרְעֹה נְכוֹ; of Egyptian derivation; Paroh-Nekoh (or -Neko), an Egyptian king; Pharaoh-necho, Pharaohnechoh.
feminine of {{h6545}} (in the sense of beginning); leadership (plural concretely, leaders); avenging, revenge.
of Egyptian derivation; Paroh, a general title of Egyptian kings; Pharaoh.
a primitive root; to loosen; by implication, to expose, dismiss; figuratively, absolve, begin; avenge, avoid, bare, go back, let, (make) naked, set at nought, perish, refuse, uncover.
from {{h6544}}; the hair (as dishevelled); locks.
patrial from {{h6539}}; a Parsite (i.e. Persian), or inhabitant of Peres; Persian.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6542}}; Persian.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6539}}; Persia, Persians.
feminine of {{h6538}}; a claw or split hoof; claw, (cloven-) footed, hoof.
of Persian origin; a grandee; (most) noble, prince.
from an unused root meaning to break forth; rushing; Perath (i.e. Euphrates), a river of the East; Euphrates.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6572}}; copy.
or פַּתְשֶׁגֶן; of foreign origin; a transcript; copy.
from {{h6567}}; (compare {{h5483}}); a steed (as stretched out to a vehicle, not single nor for mounting ); also (by implication) a driver (in a chariot), i.e. (collectively) cavalry; horseman.
the same as {{h6569}}; Peresh, an Israelite; Peresh.
of Persian origin; Parshandatha, a son of Haman; Parshandatha.
a root apparently formed by compounding {{h6567}} and that of {{h6518}} (compare {{h6574}}); to expand; spread.
from {{h6567}}; exposition; declaration, sum.
perhaps by compounding {{h6567}} and {{h6504}} (in the sense of straddling) (compare {{h6576}}); the crotch (or anus); dirt.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6599}}; a word, answer, letter or decree; answer, letter, matter, word.
of Persian origin; a (judicial) sentence; decree, sentence.
of Persian origin; a dainty; portion (provision) of meat.
(Aramaic) from {{h6590}}; an interpretation; interpretation.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6622}}; to interpret; make (interpretations), interpreting.
from the same as {{h6580}} as in the sense of comminuting; linen (i.e. the thread, as carded); flax, linen.
corresponding to {{h6591}}; interpretation.
from {{h6626}}; a bit; meat, morsel, piece.
feminine of {{h6593}}; flax; by implication, a wick; flax, tow.
or פִּתְאֹם; from {{h6621}}; instantly; straightway, sudden(-ly).
or פֹּתָה; (Ezekiel 13:19), from an unused root meaning to open; a hole, i.e. hinge or the female pudenda; hinge, secret participle
from {{h6561}}; soup (as full of crumbed meat); broth. See also {{h4832}}.

a primitive root; to break up (usually figuratively), i.e. to violate, frustrate; × any ways, break (asunder), cast off, cause to cease, × clean, defeat, disannul, disappoint, dissolve, divide, make of none effect, fail, frustrate, bring (come) to nought, × utterly, make void.
a primitive root; to break apart, disperse, etc.; break, chop in pieces, lay open, scatter, spread (abroad, forth, selves, out), stretch (forth, out).
a primitive root; to separate, literally (to disperse) or figuratively (to specify); also (by implication) to wound; scatter, declare, distinctly, shew, sting.
from {{h6556}} and {{h5798}}; break of Uzza; Perets-Uzza, a place in Palestine; Perezuzza.
a primitive root; to break off or crunch; figuratively, to deliver; break (off), deliver, redeem, rend (in pieces), tear in pieces.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6561}}; to discontinue; break off.
from {{h6561}}; rapine; also a fork (in roads); crossway, robbery.
(Aramaic) corresponding to {{h6567}}; to specify; distinctly.
from {{h6567}}; excrement (as eliminated); dung.
